Uses of Class
network.Node

    • Uses of Node in network

      Methods in network that return Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node<Message> Message.getDestination()
      Gets the Node that this message is for.
      Node<T> WrapperLink.getSink() 
      Node<T> Link.getSink()
      Gets the Node that receives data over this link.
      Node<T> WrapperLink.getSource() 
      Node<Message> Message.getSource()
      Gets the Node that generated this message.
      Node<T> Link.getSource()
      Gets the Node that transmits data over this link.
      Methods in network that return types with arguments of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<Node<T>> Node.getIdleOutputPorts()
      Gets a set of idle output ports from this node.
      Methods in network with parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Node.processMessage(int time, Node<T> source, T message)
      Processes a message that is going over the link between source and this node.
      abstract void Node.scheduleMessage(int time, Node<T> source, T message)
      Schedules message that hopped from source to this node to be an outbound message.
      void Node.transmitToNode(int time, Node<T> sink, T message)
      Transmits message to the supplied sink starting at time.
      Constructors in network with parameters of type Node 
      Constructor and Description
      Link(Node<T> source, Node<T> sink)
      Constructs a Link with the given source and sink.
      Link(Node<T> source, Node<T> sink)
      Constructs a Link with the given source and sink.
      Message(Node<Message> source, Node<Message> destination, int timestamp)
      Creates a packet heading from source to destination created at time slot time.
      Message(Node<Message> source, Node<Message> destination, int timestamp)
      Creates a packet heading from source to destination created at time slot time.
      QueuedLink(Node<T> source, Node<T> sink)
      Creates a QueuedLink between the given source and sink
      QueuedLink(Node<T> source, Node<T> sink)
      Creates a QueuedLink between the given source and sink
